sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，话题就转到一个朋友即将举行的婚礼上去了。

sentences.english: an open-air theatre (= a theatre that is outside )

sentences.chinese: 水星剧院

detailed_translations.english: a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed

sentences.english: I was in the back seat and Jo was driving.
sentences.chinese: 我在后座，乔开车。

detailed_translations.english: If you seat yourself somewhere, you sit down

sentences.english: Kids were playing and chasing each other.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在互相追逐嬉闹。

sentences.chinese: 听众大声地踏脚以表达他们的不满。

sentences.chinese: 我很生气，因为他没有告诉我他的计划。

sentences.chinese: 他开始发脾气了。

sentences.chinese: 他的话激起反对派政客愤怒的回应。

sentences.chinese: “冷静一下。”她看着他那张生气的脸说道。

sentences.chinese: 杰西笑了起来，这令我更加恼火。

sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.chinese: 母熊和它的熊崽们

detailed_translations.english: the activity of making money by producing or buying and selling goods, or providing services

sentences.english: The ticket is valid until March.
sentences.chinese: 这张票的有效期一直到 3 月份。

sentences.chinese: 他一直等到她讲完。

if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time

sentences.chinese: 这房子的外墙刷成了白色。

sentences.chinese: 现代艺术博物馆

sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆藏有大量早期的照片。

detailed_translations.english: a building where important  cultural, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).

sentences.chinese: 我认为她没有告诉我们全部实情。

sentences.chinese: 每个孩子都会收到一份小礼物。

sentences.chinese: 李得到324票。

sentences.chinese: 欲收到详细资料，请交回所附表格。

sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

sentences.chinese: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.chinese: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.chinese: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.chinese: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.chinese: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.chinese: 从中心向外辐射的线条

sentences.chinese: 软夹心巧克力

sentences.chinese: 标题并不在这页的正中间，是吗？

sentences.chinese: 我以前从未在国外生活过。

sentences.chinese: 她经常出国公干。

sentences.chinese: 有关哈利·波特的书在国内外一直都很流行。

sentences.chinese: 除了平淡乏味的报道，这儿的新闻记者将一切通过鸽子传递出去。

sentences.chinese: 顾名思义，鸽子式是一个很棘手的姿势，它对于我来说是最有挑战性的。

sentences.chinese: 这部电影的主题思想是善良终必战胜邪恶。

sentences.chinese: 暑假期间你在家吗？

sentences.chinese: 他在10年间从公司偷走了100万英镑。

sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.chinese: 医疗保健服务

sentences.english: the postal service
sentences.chinese: 邮政服务

sentences.english: the police service
sentences.chinese: 警察部门

sentences.english: the prison service
sentences.chinese: 监狱系统

sentences.chinese: 紧急服务机构的工作人员是禁止罢工的。

sentences.english: There has been a decline in public services in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来公共服务减少了。

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["the police, hospitals, fire service, and organizations that provide basic things such as water, gas, or electricity"],"COLLOINEXA":["the essential services"]}
sentences.chinese: 基础服务部门

sentences.chinese: 街头乞丐

sentences.chinese: 我喜欢意大利食物，尤其是面食。

sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

sentences.chinese: 我深陷政治之中。

sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

sentences.chinese: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.chinese: 他们拥有许多土地。

sentences.chinese: 他买了一块地。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent
someone who is very interested in a particular activity or subject

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

sentences.english: I can do my packing the night before we leave.
sentences.chinese: 我可以出发前一晚收拾行李。

detailed_translations.english: when you put things into cases or boxes so that you can send or take them somewhere

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

sentences.english: a swarm of bees
sentences.chinese: 一群蜜蜂

sentences.english: a bee sting
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂蜇伤

detailed_translations.english: a black and yellow flying insect that makes  honey  and can sting you

sentences.english: The most important member of any hive is the queen bee.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个蜂房中最重要的成员都是蜂王。

sentences.english: What people must remember is that one hive quickly become two, two become four and four become eight.
sentences.chinese: 人们一定要记住的是，一个蜂巢很快会变成两个，两个变成四个，四个变成八个。

detailed_translations.english: a small box where  bees  are kept, or the bees that live in this box

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

sentences.english: Pompeii was destroyed when the volcano erupted in 79 AD.
sentences.chinese: 庞贝城于公元79年在火山爆发中毁灭。

detailed_translations.english: a mountain with a large hole at the top, through which lava is sometimes forced out

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

sentences.english: Several people have been violently attacked in the subway.
sentences.chinese: 有几个人在地铁里受到了暴力袭击。

detailed_translations.english: with a lot of force in a way that is very difficult to control

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

sentences.english: Add a little more liquid to the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在酱汁中再加一点水。

sentences.english: Children take antibiotics in liquid form.
sentences.chinese: 儿童服用液态抗生素。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is not a solid or a gas, for example water or milk
in the form of a liquid instead of a gas or solid

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

sentences.english: It was a bad accident – they’re lucky to be alive.
sentences.chinese: 这是一宗严重事故——他们能活着实属幸运。

sentences.english: My grandparents are still alive .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母和外祖父母都还健在。

sentences.english: We stayed alive by eating berries.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃浆果活命。

sentences.english: He was kept alive on a life-support machine.
sentences.chinese: 他靠生命维持装置活着。

sentences.english: Apparently he’s alive and well and living in Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 看来他还健在，住在巴西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 活着的；活泼的；有生气的
detailed_translations.english: still living and not dead

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

sentences.english: On the night the murder was committed , he was out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 凶案发生当晚他不在国内。

sentences.english: The man accused of her murder will appear in court today.
sentences.chinese: 被指控谋杀她的那名男子将于今天出庭。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of attempted murder.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀未遂。

sentences.english: She was charged with two counts of first degree murder.
sentences.chinese: 她被控犯有两项一级谋杀罪。

sentences.english: The mother of the murder victim wept in court.
sentences.chinese: 凶案死者的母亲在法庭上痛哭。

sentences.english: Police are searching for the murder weapon.
sentences.chinese: 警方在寻找杀人凶器。

sentences.english: He was convicted of murdering a policeman.
sentences.chinese: 他被判谋杀一名警察的罪名成立。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of deliberately killing someone
to kill someone deliberately and illegally

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

sentences.english: Test your brakes after driving through water.
sentences.chinese: 车子涉水之后要检验一下刹车。

sentences.english: I managed to put the brakes on just in time.
sentences.chinese: 我最终及时刹了车。

sentences.english: Moira slammed on the brakes (=  used them suddenly and with a lot of force  ) .
sentences.chinese: 莫伊拉猛踩刹车。

sentences.english: the screech of brakes
sentences.chinese: 刹车的刺耳噪音

sentences.english: He braked sharply to avoid the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他突然急刹车，想避开那条狗。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop
to make a vehicle or bicycle go more slowly or stop by using its brake

sentences.english: She was pedalling furiously (= very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 她飞快地踩着踏板。

detailed_translations.english: to ride a bicycle
one of the two parts of a bicycle that you push round with your feet to make the bicycle go forward
of or relating to the foot or feet

sentences.english: He looked mournful, even near to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去很悲伤，几乎要掉泪了。

detailed_translations.english: If you are mournful, you are very sad

sentences.english: He must be either mad or drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他要么是疯了，要么是喝醉了。

sentences.english: Last night I got drunk and rolfed my dinner.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我喝醉了，把晚饭全吐出来了。

detailed_translations.english: unable to control your behaviour, speech etc because you have drunk too much alcohol

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose
a small square area surrounded by ropes, where people  box  or  wrestle

sentences.english: Many people are unaware of just how much food and drink they consume.
sentences.chinese: 许多人不知道自己到底消耗掉多少食物和饮料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不知道的，无意的；未察觉到的
detailed_translations.english: not noticing or realizing what is happening

sentences.english: a herd of cows with one bull
sentences.chinese: 一群母牛加一头公牛

sentences.english: a bull elephant

detailed_translations.chinese: 公牛；看好股市者；粗壮如牛的人；胡说八道；印玺
detailed_translations.english: an adult male animal of the cattle family

detailed_translations.chinese: 大型的；公牛似的；雄性的
detailed_translations.english: male; masculine

detailed_translations.chinese: 企图抬高证券价格；吓唬；强力实现

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

sentences.english: But apparently this is only an illusion.
sentences.chinese: 但显然这只是一个错觉。

sentences.english: The news had apparently been aimed at stealing the thunder from his visit.
sentences.chinese: 这篇新闻显然是在对他的访问作先声夺人的报道。

sentences.english: But if you were so inclined, apparently all you have to do work on the railroad.
sentences.chinese: 不过，如果你有这种想法的话，显然你所需要做的就是——去铁路局工作。

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

sentences.english: She bowed and left the stage.
sentences.chinese: 她鞠了一躬，离开了舞台。

sentences.english: Corbett entered the room, bowing respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 科比特走进房间，恭敬地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The servant bowed low and handed his master the sealed note.
sentences.chinese: 仆人深深一鞠躬，把那个封好的短笺递给了主人。

sentences.english: This is done with a formal bow to the king or queen.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，还要向国王或女王正式鞠躬行礼。

detailed_translations.english: to bend the top part of your body forward in order to show respect for someone important, or as a way of thanking an  audience
the act of bending the top part of your body forward to show respect for someone when you meet them, or as a way of thanking an audience

sentences.english: You shouldn’t travel alone, for safety’s sake .
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，不要独自一人旅行。

sentences.english: For your own safety , please do not smoke inside the plane.
sentences.chinese: 为了您自身的安全，请不要在飞机上吸烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打
detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is safe from danger or harm

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

sentences.english: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.english: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.english: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a building or wall

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

sentences.english: After the 1884 Convention, Greenwich officially became the place where every day, year and century began.
sentences.chinese: 1884年大会以后，格林威治正式成为每一天、每一年及每一世纪开始的地方。

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

sentences.english: She spoke confidently into the microphone.

if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot

sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.chinese: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。
